intro: Cicerbita paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical celandine, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a waxy texture and produces yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is characterized by its unique ability to thrive in rocky and arid environments. Cicerbita paradoxa is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and slopes.
